title: Ticket #2291: Parallel reconnection failing
description:
This may not be a problem yet, this is a preliminary investigation. In the following, a parallel job was started, then the schedd sent SIGSEGV.

The reconnect appears to work, but a minute or so later the startd announces, "claim no longer recognized by the schedd" and hangs up. A vanilla job submitted from the same schedd to the same startd reconnected and ran without problem.

remarks:
2012-Dec-17 11:57:49 by tannenba:
This ticket is old, and may no longer reflect reality. Assigning to Sam to first verify if indeed this bug still exists.

2013-Apr-22 16:53:54 by gthain:
I've started up a parallel job, killed the schedd in a bunch of ways, and reconnect always seems to work. Note this was on a 7.7.1 schedd, I'm leaning to closing out this ticket unless there's a better reproducer.

2013-Apr-23 14:34:46 by tannenba:
According to the ticket, reconnect did always work. What failed was claim keep alives from startds (above rank 0) after the reconnect occurred. Did you set the job lease low, kill the schedd, perform a reconnect, and watch a startd on machine rank > 0 successfully update the claim lease after the reconnect?

2013-Apr-24 13:52:25 by gthain:
Set job_lease_duration to 60, set up two startds, started parallel job across both, waited two minutes, killed schedd. restarted schedd, job reconnected and ran to completion correctly.

2013-Apr-24 13:53:07 by gthain:
But note that schedd wasn't writing LastJobLeaseRenewalDate correctly, so I'm pushing a patch for that to this ticket.
check_ins:
2013-May-16 14:54   Check-in [35714]: Version history items for #3239,#3240, and #2291 ended up in 7.9.5 section instead of 7.9.6. All moved. (By Karen Miller )
2013-Apr-24 14:48   Check-in [35541]: Document version history for #2291 (By Greg Thain )
2013-Apr-24 14:17   Check-in [35539]: Fix bug where ded sched did not persist job lease times #2291 (By Greg Thain )
creator: adesmet
